# autoHighlight

**Article**

Specifies that the element should initially be in focus.

## Overview

Use the `autoHighlight` attribute to denote the element that is initially in focus. Both the containing element and one child element must be set to `true`. Remove the `autoHighlight` attribute from your element to disable initial focus.

### Values for autoHighlight



### Elements that Use autoHighlight

- [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/alerttemplate] that contains `button` elements
- [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/catalogtemplate] that contains `listItemLockup` elements
- [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/compilationtemplate] that contains `listItemLockup` elements
- [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/descriptivealerttemplate] that contains `button` elements
- [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/grid] that contains `lockup` elements
- [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/listtemplate] that contains `listItemLockup` elements
- [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/paradetemplate] that contains `listItemLockup` elements
- [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/row] that contains any `focusable` element
- [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/segmentbar] that contains `segmentBarItem` elements.
- [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/shelf] that contains `lockup` elements
- [doc://com.apple.TVML/documentation/TVML/showcasetemplate] that contains `lockup` elements



## Valid TVML Attributes

- **binding**: Associates information in a data item with an element.
- **layoutDirection**: Specifies the direction in which text is displayed.
- **prototype**: Associates a data item type with an element.
- **theme**: Sets the color scheme for an element.
